intro: Pera glabrata, commonly known as the smooth pera, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from pink to white. It thrives in moist, well-drained soil and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens and botanical collections.
